name: vscode-mocha-test-adapter
description: Run your Mocha tests in the Sidebar of Visual Studio Code
author: Holger Benl <hbenl@evandor.de>

scripts.rebuild: npm run clean && npm run build

mochaExplorer.files.description: The glob describing the location of your test files (relative to the workspace folder)

mochaExplorer.env.description: Environment variables to be set when running the tests

mochaExplorer.cwd.description: The working directory where mocha is run (relative to the workspace folder)

mochaExplorer.ui.description: The mocha ui used by the tests

mochaExplorer.retries.description: The number of times to retry failed tests

mochaExplorer.exit.description: shutdown the Mocha process (using process.exit()) after the last test has been run

mochaExplorer.optsFile.description: The location of the mocha.opts file (relative to the workspace folder)

mochaExplorer.nodePath.description: The path to the node executable to use. By default it will attempt to find it on your PATH, if it can't find it or if this option is set to `null`, it will use the one shipped with VS Code

mochaExplorer.mochaPath.description: The path to the mocha package to use (relative to the workspace folder). By default (or if this option is set to `null`) it uses a bundled version of mocha, to use the one installed in your project's node_modules folder, set this option to "node_modules/mocha"

mochaExplorer.monkeyPatch.description: apply a monkey patch to Mocha's `bdd`, `tdd` and `qunit` interfaces to get more accurate line numbers for the tests and suites

mochaExplorer.debuggerPort.description: The port to use for debugging sessions

mochaExplorer.debuggerConfig.description: The name of a launch configuration to use for debugging sessions

mochaExplorer.ipcPort.description: The port that worker processes use to send their results to VS Code. The default is to use node's IPC mechanism for child processes instead

mochaExplorer.logpanel.description: write diagnotic logs to an output panel

mochaExplorer.logfile.description: write diagnostic logs to the given file
